q: The former American Idol judge was asked during a news conference whether viewers would see the "old Simon Cowell " or a different side to him when the show premieres on Fox later this year. Look, you adapt over the years, he replied. "I started to cringe when I started to see people being booked as the so-called mean judge and just being gratuitously rude for the sake of it. I don't like that.

SAN FRANCISCO- When Google Inc. went public in 2004, the three men running the company promised each other they would remain a ruling triumvirate for at least 20 more years. The surprise shake-up announced yesterday appears to be driven by Eric Schmidt 's desire to assume more of a behind-the-scenes role as much as Page's personal ambition. Day-to-day adult supervision no longer needed! Eric Schmidt wrote on his Twitter account moments after Google dropped the bombshell that upstaged its fourth-quarter earnings. Eric Schmidt , 55, will still be available to advise Page, 37, and Google's other 37-year-old founder

for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role-- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said Peter Schiff Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. "It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat," Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google Inc. 's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.

David Letterman asked about Justin Bieber 's schooling and found out that he's currently in the 11th grade. "11th grade-- is that a sophomore in high school?" David Letterman asked, to which Justin Bieber replied: I don't know. I'm Canadian. Later, Justin Bieber tweeted that he will be on the "Late Show" again on Friday, "playing the drums and doing the Top Ten."

As Daniels, Chris Christie , and others are in the midst of demonstrating, the post of governor is an excellent place to showcase the promise and importance of conservative governance-- and to hone the leadership and management skills that future chief executives need to be effective. Kathryn Jean Lopez says, also at National Review.Others close to the draft movement admit to be in a "funk' about Mike Pence 's decision. One stating:` Seriously, we have no one for 2012 now."
